intro: Oreosciadium andinum, commonly known as the Andean rock cress, is a flowering plant native to the high-altitude regions of South America. It belongs to the Brassicaceae family, which includes many other economically important plants. The plant is characterized by its small, cruciform flowers and hairy stems adapted to harsh, rocky environments. It typically grows in alpine meadows and mountainous areas where the climate is cold and the soil is poor. Oreosciadium andinum plays a role in stabilizing soil and providing habitat for various alpine organisms.
